item.title: By: Mark Rendle
item.dc:creator: Mark Rendle
item.content:encoded:
Of course, once you start decorating your classes and properties with attributes defined in your ORM, they’re not POCOs any more. ðŸ˜›

I think Christiaan should do a post on Simple.Data’s With methods:

db.Persons.All().WithAddress();

item.title: By: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.dc:creator: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.content:encoded:
You have to read it in the right context, in this case the context where you are writing your posts while on a pleasant vacation while I wrote that line about 5 minutes before bedtime last night at the end of a long line of busy workdays ðŸ™‚

Out of curiosity, how does Simple.Data do with stored procs?
